jmf0617 wrote:

> I am new to Eclipse and JUnit, so please bare with me, and yes I
> know this is not an Eclipse site. Maybe someone out their uses
> Eclipse and can point me in the right direction.
> 
> I downloaded Eclipse and it appears to have JUnit as part of the
> download. When I try to use JUnit as per the the "Eclipse in Action
> Workbook" I do not get the results the book indicates. Basically I
> can't get it to work. Also the release level of JUnit does not match
> the book either.
> 
> I assume I should download the latest release of JUnit and install
> it. Is their somewhere I can obtain install instructions for JUnit?
> 
> Thanks in advance for any help provided.

I've never read the book, but it should be this simple. (I'm assuming 
Eclipse 3.0, which has JUnit 3.8.1 with it.)

1. Write a test case (create class, write test method).
2. With the test case class open and the active editor window, choose 
Run > Run As > JUnit Test.

One of two things happen:

(a) You see the test runner with a green or red bar, depending whether 
your test passes.

(b) You see nothing. It appears as though nothing happened.

If (b), then you have Eclipse set with the option "do not show the JUnit 
test runner if all tests pass". It's in the Workbench preferences 
somewhere. You have two choices:

1. Change that option, which is what I did.
2. Open the JUnit view "by hand" to see the test runner. (Window > Show 
View > Other... then choose Java > JUnit from the list of all views.)

Does this help?
